case_vignette: An African-American man, aged 35 years, presents with a 3-month history of pruritic penile lesions. Examination reveals an arcuate pattern of raised violaceous-to-flesh-colored papules with central clearing on the glans penis and a few scattered, raised violaceous-to-flesh-colored polygonal papules of the glans penis and distal penile shaft. Results of the remainder of the skin examination are normal, and there is no inguinal lymphadenopathy. His sexual history includes no previous sexually transmitted diseases and no new sexual partners within the past year.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have itchy bumps on my groin that have been there for about three months.
Have you noticed any changes in color or size of these bumps over the past three months?
They're raised and some have a ring-like pattern with clearer skin in the middle, and they're kind of purplish to skin-colored.
Have you had any similar skin conditions in the past or any other chronic skin issues?
No, I haven't had any skin conditions like this before or any chronic skin issues.
Do you have any accompanying symptoms such as fever, joint pain, or weight loss?
No, I don't have any other symptoms like fever, joint pain, or weight loss.
Have you been in contact with any new soaps, detergents, fabrics, or sexual partners that may have coincided with the onset of your symptoms?
No, I haven't used any new soaps or detergents, haven't come in contact with any different fabrics, and I haven't had any new sexual partners in the past year.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for these bumps so far?
No, I haven't tried any treatments or medications for the bumps.
Do you have any known allergies or a history of atopic conditions like asthma, eczema, or seasonal allergies?
No, I don't have any known allergies or a history of conditions like asthma, eczema, or seasonal allergies.
Have the bumps spread or multiplied over the past three months, and have you noticed any pattern to the itching, like it being worse at night?
The bumps have stayed mostly on the head and upper part of my groin and yes, the itching is worse at night.
Do you have any family history of skin conditions, especially similar rashes or autoimmune disorders?
No, there's no family history of skin conditions or autoimmune disorders that I'm aware of.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea cruris (jock itch)
